title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
The user said that the system was working fine and suddenly one day its backlight was missing. I can see the laptop has been already opened by someone. Even the display assembly also opened. I have an A1706 display spare for testing, Will it work?. I don't have an A1989 working display to confirm the failure. 
I couldn't find the backlight flex cable broken physically.
Is there a way I can confirm the issue, I don't know whether it is the problem with the display or motherboard?  
I can see the display image if I use a mobile flash light.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
What is the exact backlight voltage (LCD connected)?

If you want to test with other screen, be sure the video connector has the same layout.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Could you help me with the schematic and layout of A1989 ?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: 820-xxxxx code???

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Is there an option to check the serial number without removing the board?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
Use Google and search by serial and other cover codes.
Someone may posted pictures, or board code.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
820-00850-A Apple 2.7 i7 16GB 1TB Logic Board A1989 MACBOOK PRO 13 2018 
I hope this is the one

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
Schematic/boardview available, probably already posted on the forum.
Post the voltage at C8466 (or other cap in the same row), with machine on and lid opened.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: I have tried my best to find the schematic and board view in the forum, Unfortunately couldn't find it

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: (PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT) is 1.6V which is not consistent its keep reducing

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Sometimes I can see even higher voltage (Upto 12V) But not consistent, Keep reducing

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: LCDBKLT_EN_L stays high 12V ,PP5V_G3S is 5.1V

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
Did you measure with LCD connected (above mentioned)?

You can use A1706 screen assembly for test.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Yes, Confirmed that it is not a displayed problem, Even with the a1706 display it has the same behavior, No backlight. Either the boost circuitry not working or it is the flex cable between the display and Motherboard?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Check diode mode to ground on backlight output.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Diode mode - 1.150V with and without LCD

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
Is that reading with red probe at ground?
Compare value with a good board.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Yes it is the value with red probe at ground. I don't have a working board with me sorry☹️

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: I think I have to remove the board and check the voltages on U8400 ?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
If you catched 12V at backlight output, means that is trying to start at least.
Check all traces and solders in backlight cicuitry.
Change the small video cable from MLB; need to discard it.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
The feedback resistor was corroted , Now backlight is working .
I have also seen L8504 was burned , Since the U5610 not equipped I have just removed that inductor, Do you know whats the purpose of this circuitry ?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message:
L8504 powers up webcam and ALS, through LCD connector.
If got burnt, there could be a short in the flex inside LCD assembly.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Does it mean that I have to change the screen first to fix the issue ?

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: If you do not solder L8504, no webcam function, nor ALS.

title: A1989 EMC3214, No display backlight
message: Yes ,I have measured the impedance it was high, So kept the ferrite bead back, and it's working now. Thanks
